item.title: China Leads International Opposition to Trump's Global Minimum Tax Reprieve
item.description: Top News China Leads International Opposition to Trump's Global Minimum Tax Reprieve 53 minutes ago China leads international objections to Trump's proposed global minimum tax reprieve, according to Financial Times reporting. The opposition highlights growing tensions over global tax policy coordination and implementation timelines among major economies.

item.title: Novelix Pharmaceuticals Board Approves ₹15 Crore Preferential Allotment
item.description: Novelix Pharmaceuticals Board Approves ₹15 Crore Preferential Allotment 3 minutes ago Novelix Pharmaceuticals Limited's board has approved a preferential allotment of 25,00,000 equity shares at ₹60.00 per share to raise ₹15.00 crores. The allocation covers 40 investors including promoter group members and non-promoters, with the largest allocation of 3,25,000 shares going to promoter group member Pavani Vupparapalli. An Extraordinary General Meeting is scheduled for January 9, 2026, to seek shareholder approval for this capital raising initiative.

item.title: Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025
item.description: Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025 2 hours ago Indian stock markets ended positively on December 11, with Nifty 50 up 0.55% at 25,898.55 and Sensex rising 0.51% to 84,818.13. Market breadth was bullish with 2,597 advancing stocks out of 4,548 traded. Key buzzing stocks included InterGlobe Aviation, Biocon Biologics, and Kaynes Technology, driven by company-specific news and analyst actions.

item.title: Sparc Electrex Promoter Shobha Hegde Sells 1.15 Lakh Shares in Open Market Transaction
item.description: Sparc Electrex Promoter Shobha Hegde Sells 1.15 Lakh Shares in Open Market Transaction 4 minutes ago Sparc Electrex promoter Shobha Anant Hegde sold 1,15,000 equity shares through open market on December 10, 2025, reducing her individual shareholding from 3.09% to 2.50%. The combined PAC holdings decreased from 27.12% to 26.53%. The transaction was disclosed under SEBI regulations on December 11, 2025, with proper regulatory compliance maintained throughout the process.
